title: Discussing Education and Learning
description: Practice talking about education, study habits, and learning goals.

sentences.text: If I don't study regularly, I forget things quickly.
If I pass this exam, I will apply to graduate school.
sentences.translation: 이 시험에 합격하면 대학원에 지원할 거예요.
sentences.tips: First conditional로 실제 가능한 미래를 표현하세요.

sentences.text: Unless I improve my English, I won't get the job I want.
sentences.translation: 영어 실력이 늘지 않으면 원하는 일자리를 얻지 못할 거예요.

sentences.text: When I graduate, I plan to travel for a year.
sentences.tips: 'When'도 미래에 대해 말할 때 현재시제를 사용해요.

sentences.text: If you want to learn a language, you should practice every day.
sentences.translation: 언어를 배우고 싶으면 매일 연습해야 해요.

sentences.text: I find it difficult to concentrate if there's background noise.
sentences.tips: 'find it + 형용사 + to...' 구조로 어려움을 표현하세요.

sentences.text: As soon as I finish this course, I will start the next one.
sentences.translation: 이 과정을 끝내자마자 다음 과정을 시작할 거예요.

sentences.text: In my opinion, online learning can be just as effective as classroom learning.
sentences.translation: 제 생각에는 온라인 학습도 교실 학습만큼 효과적일 수 있어요.

sentences.text: If I had more time, I would learn another language.
sentences.translation: 시간이 더 있으면 다른 언어를 배울 텐데요.

sentences.text: What subject will you study if you go to university?
sentences.translation: 대학에 가면 어떤 과목을 공부할 거예요?

sentences.text: I usually take notes if the lecture is important.
If I don't understand something, I always ask the teacher.
sentences.translation: 뭔가 이해가 안 되면 항상 선생님께 여쭤봐요.

lines.text: What will you do after you finish high school?
If I get good grades, I'll apply to study engineering at university.
That sounds great. What if you don't get the grades you need?
Then I might take a gap year and retake the exams.
That's a sensible plan. When will you find out your results?
They'll announce them next month. I'm a bit nervous.
I understand. If you study hard, you'll probably do well.
Thanks. What about you? What are your plans?
If I save enough money this year, I'll travel before starting university.
That sounds exciting! Where will you go if you have the chance?

items: Did you pronounce education-related vocabulary correctly?
Did you use appropriate intonation for conditional sentences?
Did you use rising intonation for questions?
Did you speak at a natural pace?
Did you use conditional structures smoothly?
Did you transition naturally between 'if' and main clauses?
Did you complete sentences without long pauses?
Did you practice the dialogue naturally?
Did you use Zero Conditional correctly for facts?
Did you use First Conditional correctly for future possibilities?
Did you use 'unless', 'when', 'as soon as' correctly?
Did you use present simple (not will) in the if-clause?
Did you express plans and possibilities clearly?
Did you give advice using conditionals?
Did you discuss education topics naturally?
Did you engage naturally in the dialogue?
